column4: hello ! all of you .   can any one tell me the command to know all port number and socket number (whether they are open or not )
netstat is the command - "netstat -atp" for tcp ports - I think "netstat -aup" for UDP ports... but check the man page
: what about port number where software installs
/etc/services is the list of approved numbers
: i have a small question regarding ssh , can i ask you ?
: ssh -D 1080 kav@Lex      offers me Dynamic IP adresss or what
: how can i go for Dynamic IP addressing
: so that i can be unknown
you can almost always be known
: O ! how can be i unknown
begs the question why do you want to be unknown!
:   i want to tunnel using ssh with unknown identity
: in china , we have to be unknown
: sometime it fails and even slow
